summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about the power of choosing your team! PT delivered a powerful sermon that challenges us to be intentional about the people we surround ourselves with. Isn't it amazing how our friendships can literally make or break our spiritual journey? Pastor Travis breaks down the concept of 'stacking your team' with three key insights that will transform how we view relationships. Drawing from personal experiences and biblical wisdom, he reminds us that we have the incredible freedom to choose who influences our lives. The most profound moment? When he shared how changing his circle completely transformed his life - from hanging out with athletes who partied to surrounding himself with 'Bible nerds' who helped him grow spiritually. This sermon is a wake-up call to evaluate our friendships, asking ourselves: Are these people pulling me closer to God or further away? PT's passionate delivery and personal stories make this message both convicting and inspiring, reminding us that our closest relationships are perhaps the most critical decision we'll ever make for our spiritual growth.
mainPoints: Choose friends who are running after Jesus Christ
Select teammates who are running the same race at the same pace
Surround yourself with people who will sharpen your spiritual life

versesMentioned.text: The righteous choose their friends carefully, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
As water reflects the face, so one's life reflects the company they keep.
Do not be misled: 'Bad company corrupts good character.'
Therefore, 'Come out from them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you.'
Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.
You believe that there is one God. Good! Even the demons believe that—and shudder.

Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven. Many will say to me on that day, 'Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name and in your name drive out demons and in your name perform many miracles?' Then I will tell them plainly, 'I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!'

Monday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Monday.focus: Evaluating current friendships and their spiritual impact
Monday.action: Make a list of your five closest friends. Honestly assess how each relationship either draws you closer to or pulls you away from God. Pray for discernment about any relationships that might need boundaries or change.
Monday.prayer: Lord, give me wisdom to choose friends who will challenge me to grow spiritually. Help me to be courageous in making tough friendship decisions that honor You. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 27:17: 'As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding the transformative power of godly friendships
Tuesday.action: Reach out to a spiritually mature friend and ask them to share how they've grown in their faith. Consider starting a Bible study or accountability group.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me to be a friend who sharpens others and seeks to be sharpened. Show me how to build relationships that glorify You. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Thessalonians 5:11: 'Therefore encourage one another and build each other up, just as in fact you are doing.'
Wednesday.action: Send an encouraging message to three people in your life. Make the message specific, highlighting their spiritual strengths or recent growth you've noticed.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, teach me to be an encourager. Help me see the potential in others and speak life into their journeys. Use me to build up Your people. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ecclesiastes 4:9-10: 'Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their labor: If either of them falls down, one can help the other up.'
Thursday.focus: The importance of supportive, godly relationships
Thursday.action: Reflect on a time when a friend helped you spiritually. Write a gratitude letter to that person, expressing how their friendship impacted your walk with God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, thank You for the gift of Christian friendships. Help me to be the kind of friend who supports, uplifts, and points others to You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Proverbs 22:24-25: 'Do not make friends with a hot-tempered person, do not associate with one easily angered, or you may learn their ways and get yourself ensnared.'
Friday.action: Identify one relationship that consistently drains your spiritual energy. Pray about setting healthy boundaries or seeking wise counsel about the relationship.
Friday.prayer: God, give me discernment to recognize relationships that are harmful to my spiritual health. Grant me courage to make necessary changes. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 12:10: 'Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer, asking God to help you be a better friend. Consider how you can serve someone in your life without expecting anything in return.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, transform my understanding of friendship. Help me love others as You love, selflessly and unconditionally. Make me an instrument of Your love. Amen.
